intro: Mussaenda humblotii, commonly known as the golden flame bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow inflorescences that resemble flames. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Mussaenda humblotii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display.
